Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of lotus flower and elaborate rosette with tendril in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of tip of spear above round shield with band of dots around the edge and stylised lotus flower as device; rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burned during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0817) (phase 2)
